anime.description: Popular young actors and a unique cast come together to have fun messing around and playing the roles of samurai generals. Sengoku Choujuu Giga is an anime that plays around with both Japan`s history and the generals of Japan`s sengoku period! Source: crunchyroll

tag.name: maintenance tags
tag.description: These tags are used for maintenance.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: new
tag.description: Not based on anything, the story is a new work, usually made up by the people involved in creating the anime. Generally if an original work (原作) credit is given, it will be to the studio, or director, or other members of the production team.

tag.name: short episodes
tag.description: Short episodes are regular episodes that are much shorter than the standard length. This means up to and including 10 minutes; shows with episodes that are 11 to 20 minutes in length are http://anidb.net/t6494 [half-length episodes] instead. Not to be confused with http://anidb.net/t6349 [multi-segment episodes], which are regular episodes that are split into several short segments (parts), usually with separate titles and independent storylines.

tag.name: CAST MISSING
tag.description: Important characters are missing, either in-part or entirely. This includes basic entry info (name, gender, picture), appear episode range, seiyuu and/or tags.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: STAFF MISSING
tag.description: This anime is missing staff credits. If you can, please assign staff credits to the anime accordingly and then remove the tag. If the tag is set on an anime level, please assign preferably all credits and then remove it from the anime. If that is not feasible, please assign, at a minimum, credits for all the major/key staff and then transfer it to all relevant episodes (broadly speaking, regular episodes and S-type episodes containing animation). If the tag is already set on an episode level, please assign all credits, including minor staff, to the episode and then remove the tag from it. Likewise, this tag should either be applied on an anime level, when it is missing key staff (in full or in part), or to all relevant episodes, when key staff is present but at least some episodes don`t have full staff. For further information on assigning staff credits, please see http://wiki.anidb.net/Content:Staff_Credits [the AniDB Wiki article on them].

episode.title: ぬっぺふほふ
Nuppefuhofu
Nuppefuhofu
Nuppefuhofu
episode.summary: A bizarre meat alien has landed in Imperial Japan! Can Tokugawa Ieyasu catch this foul-smelling threat? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 小田原攻め
The Assault on Odawara Castle
Odawara Kalesi’ne Saldırı
Odawara Seme
episode.summary: The Toyotomi army wants to end the siege of Houjou Ujimasa`s castle, so they send in their secret weapon: the persuasive daimyo comedy duo! But can their jokes break the stalemate? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 鶴の汁
Crane Soup
Turna Çorbası
Tsuru no Shiru
episode.summary: Meada Toshiie was once in love with Oda Nobunaga. This is his story. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 影武者オーディション
Body Double Audition.
Dublör Seçimi
Kagemusha Audition
episode.summary: Takeda Shingen wants a body double! He entertains wacky and zany candidates for the role. Then at the end, it`s revealed that that the Takeda Shingen doing the audition is actually a body double himself! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 嫌われ者
The Guy No One Likes
Sevilmeyen Adam
Kiraware Mono
episode.summary: No one likes Mitsunari. When the seven general gang up on him, Ieyasu steps into protect him... but Ieyasu might be the scariest guy of them all! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 俺は誰だ
Who Am I?
Ben Kimim?
Ore wa Dare Da
episode.summary: Akechi Mitsuhide and Toyotomi Hideyoshi swap bodies! And it`s during the middle of the assassination of Oda Nobunaga at Honnouji! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: はじめてのバナナ
My First Banana
İlk Muzum
Hajimete no Banana
episode.summary: Nobunaga and the crew are gifted a banana from Europe! No one knows how to eat it... but it looks surprisingly appropriate in Tokugawa Ieyasu`s hands. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 殿
Rear Guard
Artçı
Dono
episode.summary: Hideyoshi and Mitsuhide are arguging over who gets to be the rear guard in a losing war. Hideyoshi is so eager to be the rear guard that he ends up going to the enemy`s rear, too! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: おんな城主
Mistress of the Castle
Kalenin Yöneticisi
Onna Joushu
episode.summary: The Ii clan has been devastated by the civil wars, and there are no men left to run it. They`ll need to turn to Jirou Houshi, a female monk, to run things. But what if she doesn`t want the job? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 謙信の噂
Rumors of Kenshin
Kenshin’in Söylentileri
Kenshin no Uwasa
episode.summary: Kenshin`s retainers are suspicious of the way he talks, and the way he acts. Is he hiding a secret? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 島津四兄弟
The Four Shimazu Brothers
Dört Shimazu Kardeş
Shimazu Yon Kyoudai
episode.summary: The four Shimazu brothers are best friends. But one of them feels left out... can they make their little brother feel better? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 五大老
The Five Great Elders
Beş Asil Büyükler
Gotairou
episode.summary: The five great elders have met to discuss their persoanl problems. But they`re only making the problems worse... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 本能寺の変
The Honnoji Incident
Honnoji Olayı
Honnouji no Hen
episode.summary: The disaster at Honnoji costs the life of Oda Nobunaga and his servant, Mori Ranmaru. But before he dies, Ranmaru has one last wish: that Oda pat him firmly on the topknot. Source: crunchyroll
